jam.io
Class ImpExp

java.lang.Object
  jam.io.ImpExp
Direct Known Subclasses:
ImpExpASCII, ImpExpORNL, ImpExpSPE, ImpExpXSYS
public abstract class ImpExp
extends java.lang.Object

Abstract class for importing and exporting histograms. Gives you methods to open files and returns either an input stream or an output stream. You write a method openFile, which calls openFile(String msg,String ext) which in turn calls your implementation of readHist().

Version:
0.50
Author:
Ken Swartz
See Also:
openFile()

Method Detail

openFile

public abstract boolean openFile()
                          throws ImpExpException
Opens a file for reading. Subclasses generally should call openFile(msg,ext) which is already implemented in ImpExp.

Throws:
ImpExpException - all ImpExpExceptions go to the msgHandler

saveFile

public abstract void saveFile(Histogram hist)
                       throws ImpExpException
Saves a histogram or all histograms. Typically, the implementation calls the inherited ImpExp method saveFile(String,String,Histogram) with appropriate arguments.

Parameters:
hist - the histogram to be saved
Throws:
ImpExpException - all exceptions given to ImpExpException go to the msgHandler

getFileExtension

public abstract java.lang.String getFileExtension()
Gets the default file extension used with this file format.

Returns:
file extension (with the period)

getFormatDescription

public abstract java.lang.String getFormatDescription()
Gets a short description of the file format this class works with.

Returns:
short description of the file format]

readHist

protected abstract void readHist(java.io.InputStream inStream)
                          throws ImpExpException
Reads a histogram from the passed InputStream. The specific implementations may use this to read specific formats.

Parameters:
inStream - the stream to read the histogram from
Throws:
ImpExpException - all exceptions given to ImpExpException go to the msgHandler

writeHist

protected abstract void writeHist(java.io.OutputStream outStream,
                                  Histogram hist)
                           throws ImpExpException
Writes the passed Histogram to the passed OutputStream. The specific implementations may use this to write specific formats.

Parameters:
outStream - the stream to write the histogram to
Throws:
ImpExpException - all exceptions given to ImpExpException go to the msgHandler

openFile

protected boolean openFile(java.lang.String msg,
                           java.lang.String extension)
Opens a file with a specified dialog box title bar and file extension. It is usually called by openFile in subclasses of ImpExp.

Parameters:
msg - text to go on title bar of dialog box
extension - file extension to suggest to user
Returns:
whether file was successfully read
Throws:
ImpExpException - all exceptions given to ImpExpException go to the msgHandler

saveFile

protected void saveFile(java.lang.String msg,
                        java.lang.String extension,
                        Histogram hist)
                 throws ImpExpException
Save a specific histogram using a file dialog box. The programmer supplies a file dialog box title, a file extension, and the histogram to save. Implementers should call this from saveFile(Histogram).

Parameters:
msg - text to go on title bar of dialog box
extension - file extension to suggest to user
hist - histogram to be saved
Throws:
ImpExpException - all exceptions given to ImpExpException display on the msgHandler
See Also:
saveFile(Histogram)

                     Histogram hist)
              throws ImpExpException

ImpExpException

getFile

protected java.io.File getFile(java.lang.String msg,
                               java.lang.String extension,
                               int state)
                        throws ImpExpException
Get a file from a file dialog box. See Java 1.1 AWT Reference (J.Zukowski) page 245 and Nutshell Java Examples page 162.

Parameters:
msg - text to go on title bar of dialog box
extension - file extension to suggest to user
state - ImpExp.LOAD or ImpExp.SAVE
Returns:
a File chosen by the user, null if dialog cancelled
Throws:
ImpExpException
